name: Advanced Military
description:
In conflicts, you may choose to remove tokens from areas adjacent by land. After each round of token removal a new check for token majority must be made. You may decide to wait for other token conflicts to be resolved first.

You are allowed to cause conflict in areas containing units belonging to players holding Cultural Ascendancy.
shortDescription: You may remove tokens from adjacent land areas during conflicts, and may wait for other token conflicts to be resolved first.

name: Agriculture
description: The population limit of '0', '1', and '2' areas on the board is increased by 1 for you as long as these areas do not contain any other player's units or barbarian tokens.
shortDescription: Population limit of '0' through '2' areas may be increased by 1 for you.
calamityPenalty1: If you are the primary victim, take 5 additional damage.

name: Anatomy
bonus: Upon purchase, you may choose to acquire a science (green) card with an undiscounted price of less than 100 for free.
shortDescription: Upon purchase may acquire science card of 100 or less for free.
calamityBonus1: If you are a secondary victim, prevent 5 damage.

name: Architecture
description: Once per turn, when constructing a city you may choose to pay up to half of the required number of tokens from treasury.

name: Astronavigation
description: Your ships are allowed to move through open sea areas.

name: Calendar
shortDescription: Mitigates Famine and Cyclone.

name: Cartography
description: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 2 for 5 treasury tokens and/or from stack 7 for 13 treasury tokens per card.
shortDescription: May purchase from stacks 2 and 7 for 13 treasury tokens.
calamityPenalty1: If you are the primary victim, the beneficiary selects and replaces 1 additional coastal city.

name: Cloth Making
description: Your ships are allowed to move 5 steps.

name: Coinage
description: You may choose to increase or decrease your tax rate by 1.
calamityPenalty1: Discard 5 additional points of face value.

name: Cultural Ascendancy
description:
Players are not allowed to cause conflict in areas containing your units, except for areas where a conflict situation already occurs. This does not count for players holding Cultural Ascendancy or Advanced Military.

Your units are protected against the effect of Politics.

Your default city support rate is increased by 1.
shortDescription: Players cannot cause conflict in your areas. Protects against Politics. City support rate +1.

name: Deism
shortDescription: Mitigates Superstition.

name: Democracy
description: During the Tax Collection phase you collect tax as usual but your cities do not revolt as a result of a shortage in tax collection.

name: Diaspora
shortDescription: SPECIAL: Can move up to 5 tokens anywhere subject to population limits.
special: You may choose to take up to 5 of your tokens from the board and place them anywhere on the board, providing that no population limits are exceeded.

name: Diplomacy
description: Players are not allowed to move tokens into areas containing your cities, except for areas where a conflict situation already occurs. This does not count for players holding Diplomacy or Military.
shortDescription: Players cannot move tokens into areas containing your cities.
calamityPenalty1: The beneficiary selects and annexes 1 additional city.

name: Drama and Poetry
shortDescription: Mitigates Civil War and Civil Disorder.

name: Engineering
description:
Other players or barbarians require 8 tokens to successfully attack your cities. Your cities are then replaced by 7 tokens. This does not apply when the attacking player also holds Engineering.

You require 6 tokens to successfully attack other player's cities or pirate cities. Their cities are then replaced by 5 tokens. This does not apply when the defending player also holds Engineering.
shortDescription: Attack and defend cities more effectively.
calamityBonus1: Your city is reduced instead of destroyed.

name: Enlightenment
shortDescription: Mitigates Superstition, Slave Revolt, Epidemic, and Regression.
calamityBonus2: Your city support rate is decreased by 1 during the resolution of Slave Revolt.
calamityBonus3: If you are the primary victim, prevent 5 damage.
calamityBonus4: For each step backward, you may choose to prevent the effect by destroying 2 of your cities (if possible non-coastal)

name: Fundamentalism
shortDescription: SPECIAL: May destroy all units in an adjacent land area.
special: You may choose to destroy all units in an area adjacent by land to your units. Barbarian tokens, pirate cities and units belonging to players holding Fundamentalism or Philosophy are unaffected.
calamityPenalty1: Your marker is moved backward 1 additional step.

name: Law
shortDescription: Mitigates Tyranny, Civil Disorder, and Corruption.
calamityBonus1: The beneficiary selects and annexes 5 less unit points.
calamityBonus3: Discard 5 less points of face value.

name: Library
shortDescription: Discount one other Advance purchase this turn by 40; Mitigates Regression.
bonus: You may discount the cost of one other Civilization Advance that you purchase in the same turn as Library by 40 points.
calamityBonus1: Your marker is moved backward 1 less step.

name: Masonry
shortDescription: Mitigates Cyclone.
calamityBonus1: Reduce 1 less of your selected cities.

name: Medicine
shortDescription: Mitigates Epidemic.

name: Metalworking
description: In conflicts, for each round of token removal all other players not holding Metalworking must remove their token first.

name: Mining
description:
During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 6 and/or stack 8 for 13 treasury tokens per card.

Treasury tokens are worth 2 points when purchasing Civilization Advances.
shortDescription: May acquire cards from stack 6 and 8 for 13 treasury tokens; treasury tokens are worth 2 points when purchasing Advances.
calamityPenalty1: Your city support rate is increased by 1 during the resolution of Slave Revolt.

name: Monarchy
description: You may choose to increase your tax rate by 1.
calamityPenalty2: The beneficiary selects and annexes 5 additional unit points.

name: Monotheism
shortDescription: SPECIAL: May choose to annex all units in an adjacent land area.
special: You may choose to annex all units in an area adjacent by land to your units. Barbarian tokens, pirate cities, and units belonging to players holding Monotheism or Theology are unaffected.

name: Monument
bonus: Acquire 20 additional points of credit tokens in any combination of colors.
shortDescription: Acquire 20 additional points of credit tokens.

name: Military
description:
Your movement phase is after all other players not holding Military have moved.

You are allowed to move tokens into areas containing cities belonging to players holding Diplomacy.
shortDescription: You move after all other players not holding Military do.  Counteracts Diplomacy.

name: Music
shortDescription: Mitigates Civil War and Civil Disorder.

name: Mysticism
shortDescription: Mitigates Superstition.

name: Mythology
shortDescription: Mitigates Slave Revolt.
calamityBonus1: Your city support rate is descreased by 1 during the resolution of Slave Revolt.

name: Naval Warfare
description:
Your ships are allowed to carry 6 tokens.

In conflicts, you may choose to remove ships from the conflict area instead of tokens. After each tound of token removal a new check for token majority must be made.
shortDescription: Your ships can carry 6 tokens. May remove ships instead of tokens during conflicts.
calamityBonus1: If you are the primary victim, the beneficiary selects and replaces 1 less coastal city. You may not be selected as a secondary victim.

name: Philosophy
shortDescription: Mitigates Iconoclasm and Heresy.

name: Politics
shortDescription: SPECIAL: May gain up to 5 treasury tokens OR annex all units in adjacent land area for one treasury token each.
special:
You may choose one of two options:
1) Gain up to 5 treasury tokens from stock.
2) Annex all units an area adjacent by land to your units. Pay treasury tokens equal to the to the number of units annexed, or the effect is cancelled. Barbarian tokens, pirate cities, and units belonging to players holding Politics or Cultural Ascendancy are unaffected.

name: Pottery
shortDescription: Mitigates Famine.

name: Provincial Empire
shortDescription: SPECIAL: May force up to five adjacent players to give you a commodity card.
special: You may choose to select up to five players that have units adjacent by land or water to your units. These players must choose and give you a commodity card with a face value of at least 2. Players holidng Provincial Empire or Public Works may not be selected.
calamityPenalty1: Five additional barbarian tokens are used.
calamityPenalty2: The beneficiary selects and annexes 5 additional unit points.

name: Public Works
description:
Areas containing your cities may also contain 1 of your tokens.

You are protected against the effect of Provincial Empire.
shortDescription: Your city areas may also contain 1 token. Counteracts Provincial Empire.

name: Rhetoric
description: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 3 for 9 treasury tokens per card.

name: Roadbuilding
description:
When moving over land, your tokens may move 2 areas. Tokens that are in a conflict situation after one step are not allowed to move any further.

Your hand limit of trade cards in increased by 1.
shortDescription: When moving over land, your tokens may move 2 areas; trade card hand limit increased by 1.
calamityPenalty1: If you are the primary victim, take 5 additional damage.

name: Sculpture
shortDescription: Mitigates Tyranny.
calamityBonus1: The beneficiary selects and annexes 5 less unit points.

name: Theology
description: Your units are protected against the effect of Monotheism

name: Theocracy
shortDescription: Mitigates Iconoclasm and Heresy.
calamityBonus1: You may choose to discard 2 commodity cards to prevent the city reduction effect for you.

name: Trade Empire
description: Once per turn, you may choose to use 1 substitute commodity card of at least the same face value when turning in an incomplete set of commodity cards.
shortDescription: May substitute 1 commodity card of same or better face value when turning in incomplete set.
calamityPenalty1: Select and reduce 1 additional city adjacent to the open sea area.
calamityPenalty2: If you are the primary victim, take 5 additional damage.

name: Trade Routes
shortDescription: SPECIAL: You may choose to discard commodity cards to gain treasury tokens at twice their face value.
special: You may choose to discard any number of commodity cards to gain treasury tokens at twice the face value of the commodity cards discarded this way.

name: Universal Doctrine
shortDescription: SPECIAL: Annex 1 pirate city or up to 5 barbarian tokens anywhere on the board.
special: You may choose to annex 1 pirate city or up to 5 barbarian tokens anywhere on the board.

name: Urbanism
description: Once per turn, when constructing a wilderness city you may choose to use up to 4 tokens from areas adjacent by land.

name: Wonder of the World
description:
During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire 1 additional trade card for free from a stack number that is higher than your number of cities in play.

Wonder of the World counts as a city during the A.S.T.-alteration phase.
shortDescription: May acquire 1 additional trade card from next-higher stack; counts as a city during A.S.T.-alternation.
calamityPenalty1: Discard 5 additional points of face value.

name: Written Record
shortDescription: Acquire 10 additional points of credit tokens.
bonus: Acquire 10 additional points of credit tokens in any combination of colors.
